review_blob: (1 pt. 9 oz. bottle)  Pours murky medium gold with very active carbonation.  Very little head on light pour.  Malts, light fruit, and alcohol make the nose.  Tingly mouthfeel with smooth finish.  Nothing exciting.
Pours a huge unatural head that lasts.  Medium amber in color.  Malt and toffee nose.  Very creamy with hint of banana.  Seems odd to me.
Pale yellow with small layer of head that lasts.  Active carbonation.  Malt and citrus nose.  I dislike the taste of this one.  Funky malts and dirty tasting.  echk
UPDATED: MAR 1, 2005
Frothy head wth medium amber body.  I couldnt get much of the nose except light hops.  Slight honey taste.  Perfectly smooth start to finish.  (12 oz bottle)

(12 oz bottle) Pours light medium amber.  Decent head sits perfectly still.  Flower, light hop, and sweet malty notes run the nose.  That SS funky malt always seems present.  Slight bitter finish.  Blah

(12 oz bottle) Very dark ruby with frothy head that lasts.  Slight hop and musty nose.  The mouthfeel is very light.  Im not liking the hops in this one at all.  Smoke and coffe flavors are good but, I cant get over the hops.

Very bubbly head sits atop a very beautiful white gold pour. Might be the "prettiest" beer I have seen.  Very little quick moving carbonation.  Alcohol, apple, light fruit and grass flavors rule this one.  I do like the not to sweet flavor.  Light mouthfeel with lots of tingle.  Seems to pack quite a punch at 8.5%.  Not what I expected at all  but I liked it, simple as it is.  (330 ml bottle)

( 04 12 oz bottle)  Pours red amber with  frothy head that lasts.  Smells strongly of hops and pine.  Tastes strongly of resins and  grapefruit.  Bitter (not to much) and strong aftertaste.  Another good one from SN.  Wish the alcohol was a bit higher though.

(650 ml bottle)  Pours cloudy gold with a hint of red.  Good amount of head  that lasts.  Smellls of grapefruit and orange rinds although a bit sweet.  I can drink this all night.  Clean taste, crystal hops, citrus, and tart finish.  I like this one and may make it a regular thing.
beer_name: Rogue Nation Brutal India Pale Ale

review_blob: (650ml bottle)  Pours almost completely black with quite a bit of head that leaves much lacing.  All I smell is fruit and maybe alcohol.  (weird)   Coffee, chocolate, and raisins rule the flavor.  Very creamy mouthfeel and finish.  I like this one but could have done without the hops.

(12 oz) Cap came off rather easily.  Pours very cloudy amber with almost no head.  Smells strongly of orange rind  and grapefruit.  Bit of hops and citrus flavors.  I think ill stick with SNPA even though this is semi-local.

(12 oz bottle) Pours medium brown with reddish hue.  Has very little head that doesnt last or leave lacing.  Smells of malts and sweet fruit.  Has a honey, nut, and, medium malt flavor with a smooth finish.    Its not bad but, it seems a little expensive for what it is.

(12 oz bottle)  Pours a beautiful light ruby with a frothy short head.  Strong hop and citrus nose.  Malt, berry, hops, pine and citrus flavors work well together.  This is my first barley wine and gives me hope for the rest of them.

(12 oz botte)  Pours almost opaque ruby with a tan frothy head.  Leaves a pretty solid lacing throughout the glass.  Tastes of vanilla, chocolate, roasted malts and finishes with slight bitterness.  Mouthfeel is a bit oily but not unpleasant.  I like this mix although it is a bit sweet.

(650 ml bottle)  Very large off white head sits atop a cloudy golden pour.  Slight hop nose.  I like a bit more hops in the flavor but, nothing is bad here.  Very dry finish with a touch of honey.  I like RA but, Im not excited about this one.

Dark brown pour with smallish off white head.  Smells of yeast.  Sweet malt and sugar cookie taste.  Unpleasant bread aftertaste.  Odd oily mouthfeel.  I didnt like this and I dont like the NB "biscuit" taste.  (12 oz bottle)

(12 oz bottle)  Pours rather deep red amber with less than a finger of head.  No lacing present.  Smells of very ripe fruits and a touch of alcohol.  Taste is no different except for some "clean" fruit or citrus flavors.  This is my favorite type of beer(from what little I have tried) and, I like this best.

(12 oz bottle/shaker)  Medium burnt red pour with little head that leaves a very spaced lacing.  Light tastes of roasted malt and a touch of honey.  It was better than i expected but, not worth the price.

Falling out of the bottle deep red and, when in glass sits perfectly opaque.  Frothy and foaming head with little lacing.  Smells of plums, banana, and alcohol.  Sharp  tastes of alcohol and peppers.  Bitter (good bitter)aftertaste present.  Mouthfeel was very light unfortunately.  Slight velvet touch saved it.  (650 ml bottle)

(12oz bottle) Pours very light amber with very little head that quickly dissapates.  Tiny pockets of carbonation present.  Smells of light malts and light vegetation.  Nice balance of malts and ripe fruit.  Sparkling mouthfeel that is a little dry in the end.  A medium tart and bitter atertaste.  I liked this one. My favorite New Belgium so far.

Pours medium amber with very little short lasting head.  Smells of roasted malts and slight hops.  Tastes of the same with orange and maybe sour fruits.  As it warmed it got a little tart.  Tingly mouthfeel but, medium bodied.  (12 oz bottle)
Pours very light gold with medium tight head.  Smells of light hops.  A very tasteless beer, very little vegatation and  malt flavors.  Boring for sure.
Pours deep amber with two fingers of head.  Smells of strong funky malts.  The ever present SS musty flavor is there.  An overall solid beer but, it didnt do anything for me.

(1pt 9.4 fl oz.)  Huge rollin head that sits atop a hazy brown pour.  Smells slighty of malt and very ripe fruit.  Wow.  A bubbly full mouhfeel.  A very nice well balanced taste.  I really enjoyed just looking at this one produce a wonderful full lacing and letting it warm.  Although alcohol was not present at the beginning of bottle it was rather obvious later.  I think Ill run out and pick up the rest of the Chimay line.  Very good.

(12 oz bottle/shaker best by 08-12-05)  Pours almost opaque red with two fingers of head.  No visible carbonation.  Smells strongly of of chocolate and malt.  Tastes of raisins and palate is very oily with sweet aftertaste.

(650 bottle/shaker)  Milky medium golden pour with white frothy head.  No visible carbonation and small amount of residue at bottom of bottle.  Smells slightly of citrus and malt.  Taste doesnt differ much from nose.  A little bit of hops thrown in the mix.  A rather light tasting beer that would be good for a day of work in the yard.
Overwhelming strawberry and fruit nose.  Ill use another raters commments on this one,  annoying artificial tasting flavors.  A pale with kool-aid added.  Not my thing.  (12oz bottle)

Pours perfectly pitch black with a small frothy tan head that floats on top leaving a long lasting lace.  Nose is alcohol,  rotten fruit and must.  Tastes strongly of molasses and brown sugar.  A good beer thats available anywhere.

Pours murky red with smallish head.  No visible carbonation or lacing.  Smells of light malt and citrus.  I like the medium mouthfeel.  Not bad, maybe BBC can make some decent beers. (12 oz bottle/shaker)

Pours nearly opaque fuchsia with small amount of head that leaves a swiss cheese lacing.  I have to admit ahead of time that im not to much into the raspberry flavor or nose.  It seems way overdone and for me that was the downfall of this one.  It did mellow out as my taste buds adjusted, but still not my thing.  (12oz)
Pours milky gold with very little head.  Smells of trash bins and rotten eggs.(maybe bad bottle)  A bit of honey in the taste but overall a tart and possibly skunky beer.

(12oz/shaker) Pours deep and dark with very little head that quickly runs away leaving no lacing.  Smells of chocolate and must.  Malt with coffee notes run this beer.  I wanted to like this one coming from KC and all, but I dont.  The bad bitter finsh was the worst.

Auburn pour with one finger of head that lasts.  A very welcome malt and citrus nose pairs with a honey flavor.  Palate is very tingly and light.  My favorite part of this one is the finish, smooth and slightly sweet.  My favorite Sam Adams so far.  (12oz bottle/shaker)
nice dark pour with decent looking lace coming from very little head...roasty aroma and flavor....much better when warm....not bad at all (12 oz bottle)
medium head that stays for awhile..basic gold in color...smells a little funky...but not all that bad just nothing exciting

pours a pretty dark red w/ no head....i hope that is not a bad sign ...smells a bit of coffee and smoke/roast... a thicker mouthfeel than other samuels i have had..nice malty flavor with roasted notes..not bad..my favorite samuel smith yet (550 bottle)

(Bob Marley in the background-pint 6 bottle) pours hazy burnt orange w/ very little head(may have lost on the opening) smells of smoke and not much else..feels great in the mouth..a bit strong/smokey at the top of the glass but quickly balances out..i hope no one pours it out right away because it brings in malt and a meaty taste later..pretty damn good..lets get together and feel alright..lol

nice large head...golden with reddish swirls..smells of fruit..grapes and orange...ive never drank a beer like this..sparkling/bubbly mouthfeel taste fruity and later quit bitter...its something else..very nice (11.2oz bottle 10-03-04)
not totally tasteless but close...better than bud light...my friends still drink this crap on the regular

nasty crap man....blah blah blah...light in hops and very thin...just a boring as all hell beer..i wont bother with this one again...as i was reading other reviews someone said dirty..i agree (12oz bottle)
nice golden color..with very little head...smells of hops..i like this beer even though im not into the IPA thing...maybe because its a little on the light side (12oz bottle)
UPDATED: FEB 22, 2005

smells very malty/strong..very little head..medium dark red...very little chocolate or something in the taste...i like it much better than the oatmeal stout..a decent beer if a little thin (500 ml bottle)
good size long lasting head..a lot of carbonation...a bit sickly looking yellow..smelled funky/musty...strong malt taste almost like beef broth..ech..bottle
UPDATED: JAN 31, 2005

very very dark with decent tan head chocolate everywhere smell/taste/aftertaste 
a little bitter in the end...i like this beer quite a bit...was not disapointed (pint 6oz bottle)
good sized head dark-very dark red smells smokey w/ chocolate tastes of caramel (?) and chocolate.. a bit on the thin side i thought...i was kind of disappointed..but glad i can get this any time
very little head and dingy amber..smells of fruit...tastes of grapefuit and oranges??...kick ass half gallon bottle was the better part of this beer

(bottle) huge rolling head..uneven strange lacing..smelled like soap and celery..tasted like vegetation and soap...very thin in the mouth..odd maybe just not my thing..can get plenty of this and will trade for most anything
beer_name: Boulder Beer Hazed Hoppy Session Ale
